original: Moberg, Erik Axelsson, med. dr, Göteborg, f. 5/1/05 i Lund av prof. Axeil M. o. len Nils’son-Rodhe. G. 34 m. RK-sys’tern Märta Jenner. Barn: Gunnar f. 35, Erik 37, Amita 40. — Stud:ex. 23, med. >kand. 27, med. lic. 32 o. med. dr 36, allt i Lund, stud. i handkir. i USA 47. Do c. i exp. patok v. Lunds univ. 36. Studrres. t. Engk, Tyskk, USA m. fk länder. Aman:tj. v. histoil. o. anatom. inst. d Lund 26-29, 30-31 o. 34, fabriksdäk. v. istatskrut-bruk i Iran 32-33, aman. v. bakteriol. inst. i Lund 34-35, aman. o. assist, v. patol. inst. 36, amian. o. undrläk. v. kir. IkLin. i Lund 36-38, aman. v. orto-ped. kliin. 39, läk:tj. v. röntgen-diagn. klin. 40, v. Karok inst. ortoped. klin. i Sthim 41, v. S:t Görans ’sjukh. 42, iläk. v. SaMgr. isjukh. kir. avd. ^sed. 42, bitr. ilas :läk. där sed. 46. Skr.: ett 20-tail vet :iskapl. arb., huv:sakl. inom exp. patologi, ortopedi o. kir.
translated: Moberg, Erik Axelsson, MD, Gothenburg, b. 5/1/05 in Lund, son of Prof. Axel M. and Lena Nils'son-Rodhe. Married in 1934 to RK-sister Märta Jenner. Children: Gunnar b. 1935, Erik b. 1937, Amita b. 1940. — Graduated from high school in 1923, received medical degree in 1927, medical license in 1932, and doctorate in medicine in 1936, all from Lund University. Studied hand surgery in the USA in 1947. Completed clinical training at Lund University Hospital in 1936. Studied abroad in England, Germany, the USA, and other countries. Assistant at the historical and anatomical institutes in Lund from 1926-1929, 1930-1931, and 1934, factory doctor at the State Rifle Factory in Iran from 1932-1933, assistant at the bacteriology institute in Lund from 1934-1935, assistant and assistant physician at the pathology institute in 1936, trainee and junior physician at the surgical clinic in Lund from 1936-1938, assistant at the orthopedic clinic in 1939, medical officer at the radiology diagnosis clinic in 1940, at the Karolinska Institute orthopedic clinic in Stockholm in 1941, at S:t Görans Hospital in 1942, and at Sankt Maria's Hospital surgical department since 1942, and deputy county medical officer there since 1946. Published around twenty scientific papers, mainly focusing on experimental pathology, orthopedics, and surgery.
